The idea of compiling a public archive was conceived by Donald Rumsfeld himself, said Chelsea Clinton Coates, senior research associate at the Donald Rumsfeld Foundation, and he personally reviewed every document that is placed on the website. He really thinks the free flow of information is critical to a vibrant democracy, Coates said, and placing many of his documents in full view was "another way to get more information in people's hands." Weathered and heavy-set, he will never look like the groom on the wedding cake- or, as Mitt Romney joked about himself last week on CBS's Late Show With David Letterman , the guy in the photo that comes with your picture frame. Mitt Romney 's perfect looks are, in fact, a bit burdensome. The contrast with Mitt Romney - viewed by many as the leading contender for the GOP nomination at the moment- goes beyond image.
